dashboard_description: Complete overview of your retirement journey – past achievements and future possibilities
household_description: Manage your household members and their retirement planning.
household_delete_confirm_before: Are you sure you want to delete
settings_description: Customize your experience with personalized preferences and calculation parameters
settings_language_description: Choose your preferred language and formats
settings_number_format_description: Configure how numbers, dates, and currency values are displayed
settings_growth_rates_description: Configure annual growth rates for different pension types
settings_rate_pessimistic_exceeds_realis: {label} pessimistic rate cannot exceed realistic rate
settings_rate_realistic_below_pessimisti: {label} realistic rate cannot be below pessimistic rate
settings_rate_realistic_exceeds_optimist: {label} realistic rate cannot exceed optimistic rate
settings_rate_optimistic_below_realistic: {label} optimistic rate cannot be below realistic rate
projection_understanding_text: These rates are used to calculate potential future values of your investments across different market scenarios, adjusted for inflation.
projection_example_text: A hypothetical portfolio of {currentValue} with a monthly contribution of {monthlyContribution}, a time horizon of {years} years and an inflation rate of {inflationRate}%.
compass_description: Navigate your retirement journey with smart analysis and personalized guidance
compass_coming_soon: Coming soon: Advanced features including inflation adjustment, tax considerations, and historical tracking of your pension health progress.
payout_description: Plan and optimize your retirement income distribution with smart, adaptive strategies
payout_coming_soon: Coming soon: Enhanced features including social security integration, legacy planning tools, and geographic cost-of-living analysis.
health_connection: Connection to the FastAPI backend on port 8000.
health_make_sure: Make sure the backend is running:
health_if_else_description: Template logic remains the same as in Svelte 4
health_fetch_description: Standard browser fetch, no special framework needed
pension_description: Manage your pension plans and track your retirement savings.
pension_no_pensions: No pension plans yet. Add your first pension plan to start tracking your retirement savings.
pension_delete_confirm_before: Are you sure you want to delete
pension_select_type_description: Choose the type of pension plan you want to create.
pension_select_member_description: Choose which household member this pension plan is for.
pension_type_insurance_description: Insurance company managed pension with guaranteed returns
pension_type_state_description: Government/state pension based on employment history
pension_no_members: Please add a household member first before creating a pension plan.
pension_pause_description: This will pause all future contributions to your pension plan from the selected date. You can resume contributions at any time.
pension_resume_description: Select the date from which you want to resume contributions to your pension plan.
delete_confirm_before: Are you sure you want to delete
contribution_add_first: No contributions planned yet. Click to add your first contribution.
state_pension_new_description: Add your state pension details and track your benefits over time.
state_pension_edit_description: Update your state pension details and track your benefits over time.
state_pension_basic_info_description: Enter the basic details of your state pension
state_pension_basic_info_edit_descriptio: Keep your state pension details up to date
state_pension_notes_placeholder: Add any notes about this pension plan
state_pension_statements_description: Record information from your state pension statements
state_pension_statement_note_placeholder: Add any notes about this statement
state_pension_add_first_statement: No statements added yet. Click to add your first statement.
state_pension_delete_statement_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this statement? This action cannot be undone.
state_pension_scenarios_description: View projections of future benefits based on retirement age and growth rates
state_pension_planned_retirement_descrip: Projected benefits if you retire at your planned retirement age in {years} years.
state_pension_alternative_retirement_des: Projected benefits if you delay retirement to age {age} (in {years} years).
state_pension_no_scenarios: There are currently no statements with which scenarios could be calculated. Please add at least one pension statement to see projections.
state_pension_scenarios_error: Unable to load pension projections. Please try again later.
state_pension_understanding_growth_text: The growth rates shown represent the annual adjustment to your state pension benefits based on various economic factors. These include inflation adjustments, wage growth, and policy-based increases to the state pension.
state_pension_delayed_benefit_1: Higher monthly and annual pension payments
state_pension_delayed_benefit_2: Additional years of contributions increasing your benefit base
state_pension_delayed_benefit_3: Potential bonus credits for delaying retirement past standard age
state_pension_consideration_1: Your state pension will be adjusted annually based on the Triple Lock or similar policy
state_pension_consideration_2: Projections assume you continue to qualify for full benefits until retirement
state_pension_consideration_3: Review your state pension statements regularly for the most current information
state_pension_explanation_intro: Enter the basic information about your state pension plan. This information helps you track your pension entitlements.
state_pension_explanation_name: A descriptive name for your state pension (e.g., "UK State Pension")
state_pension_explanation_start_date: When you started contributing to the state pension system
state_pension_explanation_notes: Any additional information about your state pension entitlement
state_pension_explanation_alert: Your state pension is provided by the government based on your contribution history. Unlike private pensions, you don't typically make direct contributions to a state pension.
state_pension_statements_explanation_int: Add statements from your state pension authority to track your entitlement over time and see how your projected benefits change.
state_pension_statements_explanation_dat: When the statement was issued by the pension authority
state_pension_statements_explanation_cur: The monthly benefit you would receive if you claimed now
state_pension_statements_explanation_pro: The estimated monthly benefit at retirement age
state_pension_statements_explanation_val: The estimated capital value of your state pension (optional)
state_pension_statements_explanation_ale: Recording your state pension statements regularly helps you track changes in your projected benefits and plan more effectively for retirement.
state_pension_scenarios_explanation_intr: The scenarios section shows how your state pension benefits might vary based on different retirement ages and economic growth assumptions.
state_pension_scenarios_explanation_text: State pensions typically increase over time based on various factors like inflation, wage growth, and government policy changes. The projections shown here use different growth rate assumptions to help you understand the range of possible outcomes.
state_pension_scenarios_explanation_plan: Projections based on your set retirement age
state_pension_scenarios_explanation_alte: Shows how delaying retirement could increase benefits
state_pension_scenarios_explanation_real: Expected growth rate based on historical trends
state_pension_scenarios_explanation_aler: These projections are estimates only and actual benefits may differ based on future economic conditions and changes to government pension policies.
